Class LibraryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tuprologx.ide.LibraryManager

  • public final class LibraryManager
extends Object
    A dynamic manager for tuProlog libraries.
    Version:
    1.1 - 27-may-05
    Author:
    Giulio Piancastelli

      • isLibraryLoaded

        public boolean isLibraryLoaded(String libraryClassname)
        Check if a library is loaded into the Prolog engine.
        Parameters:
        libraryClassname - The complete name of the library class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the library is loaded into the engine, false otherwise.

      • addLibrary

        public void addLibrary(String libraryClassname)
                throws ClassNotFoundException,
                       InvalidLibraryException
        Add a library to the manager.
        Parameters:
        libraryClassname - The name of the .class of the library to be added.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if the library class cannot be found.
        InvalidLibraryException - if the library is not a valid tuProlog library.

      • addLibrary

        public void addLibrary(String libraryClassname,
                       File file)
                throws ClassNotFoundException,
                       InvalidLibraryException
        Add a library to the manager.
        Parameters:
        libraryClassname - The name of the .class of the library to be added.
        path - The path where is contained the library.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if the library class cannot be found.
        InvalidLibraryException - if the library is not a valid tuProlog library.

      • removeLibrary

        public void removeLibrary(String libraryClassname)
                   throws InvalidLibraryException
        Remove a library to the manager.
        Parameters:
        libraryClassname - The name of the .class of the library to be removed.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - if the library class cannot be found.
        InvalidLibraryException - if the library is not a valid tuProlog library.
